description: In this course, the viewer will learn the following, design and implement functional networks as well as configuring, managing, and maintaining essential network devices. They will also look at various network devices such as routers and switches, also well as identifying  benefits and drawbacks of existing network configurations. They will also look at common network security, standards, and protocols and well as troubleshooting common network issues.
descriptionMD: In this course, the viewer will learn the following, design and implement functional networks as well as configuring, managing, and maintaining essential network devices. They will also look at various network devices such as routers and switches, also well as identifying  benefits and drawbacks of existing network configurations. They will also look at common network security, standards, and protocols and well as troubleshooting common network issues.
name: CompTIA Network+ (N10-007)
subtitle: Vendor-neutral networking

episodes.description: The Network+ certification was introduced by CompTIA in 1999 and was designed to do for Network Technicians what the A+ certification did for Computer Technicians. Obtaining Network+ certification shows that the holder possess the same knowledge and skills of someone who has worked for nine months as a Network Technician. The Network+ exam covers topics ranging from theory (terminology, topology and design) to hardware (routers, switches and cabling) and provides users with a broad, vendor neutral perspective on the topics required to work in the field of Network Administration.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore different ports and protocols used for communication in modern computer networks. They look at protocols like SSH, DNS, FTP.....etc and their associated ports.
episodes.title: Ports and Protocols

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore different ports and protocols used for communication in modern computer networks. They look at protocols like SSH, DNS, FTP.....etc and their associated ports.
episodes.title: Ports and Protocols Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the Open Systems Interconnection model \(OSI model\). They look at some of the applications, devices and protocols that operated within the different layers of the OSI model.
episodes.title: OSI Model

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of network communications. They look at concepts like unicast, multicast, broadcast domains and more.
episodes.title: Network Traffic Properties

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of network communications. They look at concepts like CSMA/CD and CSMA/CA as well as MTUs and PDUs.
episodes.title: Network Traffic Properties Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of switching technologies. They look at concepts like unicast, multicast, broadcast domains and more.
episodes.title: Switching Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode Zach Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of routing technologies. They will look routing protocols like difference between interior gateway routing protocols and exterior gateway routing protocols. They will talk about a distance-vector routing protocol known as RIP and RIPv2.
episodes.title: Routing Technologies

episodes.description: In this episode Zach Wes dive into the various characteristics and attributes of routing technologies. They look at distance-vector protocols like EIGRP, a link-state routing protocol called OSPF as well as a path-vector routing protocol called BGP. They will look at other concepts like NAT and PAT, routing types and port forwarding
episodes.title: Routing Technologies Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into the concepts surrounding performance of the network. They look at some of the ways networks can grant specific types of traffic more or less of the network resources to ensure quality-of-service.
episodes.title: Network Performance Concepts

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They look an IP address format and how to convert IP addresses from decimal format to binary format as well as base10 and base2 numbering systems.
episodes.title: IP Addressing

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They continue their look at subnet masks and decimal to binary conversion. They explain subnet masks.
episodes.title: IP Addressing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They explain in more detail how subnet masks apply to ip addresses, as well as how to identify the network versus node portions of an IP address.
episodes.title: IP Addressing Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode -- and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They look at topics like classful vs. classless addressing, subnet masks, subnetting and IP address assignments.
episodes.title: IP Addressing Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They look at classless subnet masks and the valid subnet mask ranges as well as some tips for the exam.
episodes.title: Classless IPv4 Addressing

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IP addressing. They look at classless subnet masks and the valid subnet mask ranges as well as some tips for the exam.
episodes.title: Classless IPv4 Addressing Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration on  the basic concepts of subnetting. They look applying classless subnet masks to networks to create smaller networks. They demonstate the concepts with examples.
episodes.title: Classless IPv4 Addressing Part 3

episodes.description: n this episode Zach and Wes continue their exploration on the basic concepts of subnetting. They look applying classless subnet masks to a larger network to create smaller networks. They continue their demonstatation of the concepts with additional examples inluding VLSM
episodes.title: Classless IPv4 Addressing Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes dive into how IP addresses are configured on nodes inside of modern networks. The look at concepts like DHCP, static assignments, EUI-64 and more
episodes.title: IP Address Assignments

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IPv6 addressing. They look at topics like tunneling, dual stack, router advertisements and neighbor discovery

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes explore the basic concepts of IPv6 addressing. They look at topics like tunneling, dual stack, router advertisements and neighbor discovery

episodes.description: In this episode Zach and Wes discuss different network topologies. They will look at the different network types like LANs, WANs and WLANs. They will also look at various concepts surrounding Internet of Things or IoT
